docs.snippet: ESPN, once the king of sports programming, now competes with companies that offer instant statistics and highlights, and, increasingly, games.

docs.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin has called repeatedly for unity in fighting terrorism. President Trump seemed to take up that call, at least momentarily, on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: Readers respond to “Rising Star,” books on violent periods of American history, and more.

docs.snippet: A noose was found last week at the United States Mint in Philadelphia. It was the latest in a series of such cases, especially in the nation’s capital.

headline.print_headline: Nooses, Potent Symbols of Hate, Crop Up in Rash of Cases
headline.main: Hangman’s Noose, Symbol of Racial Animus, Keeps Cropping Up

docs.snippet: Bizet’s classic opera has been staged by Dmitri Tcherniakov at the Aix Festival in France as an intervention for a numb patient’s psyche.

headline.print_headline: Tragic Pawn In a Therapy Nightmare
headline.main: Review: ‘Carmen,’ Boldly Rewritten as Therapy for a Modern Man

docs.snippet: Lee Kuan Yew, who died in 2015, stipulated that his home should eventually be destroyed. Two of his children have accused the third, the prime minister, of defying those wishes for political gain.

headline.print_headline: Family Dispute Over House of Singapore’s Founder Erupts as National Crisis
headline.main: Dispute Over Singapore Founder’s House Becomes a National Crisis

docs.snippet: Go more than once, purchase tickets ahead of time and check stores for gift cards.

docs.snippet: “People in Punjab wear very bright, vibrant colors,” said Mark Hartman, a photographer based in Brooklyn who spent March in India. “To me, it shows a sense of pride and confidence.”
